Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CPF-SE3 (CPF-SP2; XT-6; Leu-rich; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXA; UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: Cameroon Clawed Frog, the tetraploid frogSilurana epitropicalisSE1, andSilurana paratropicalis,  alsoXenopus tropicalis, Africa

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Moderately active against E. coli (MIC 40-50 uM) and highly active against S. aureus ATCC 25923 and MRSA (MIC 2.5-5 uM). The 2000 paper reported an MIC 80 uM against S. aureus for XT-6 isolated from Xenopus tropicalis (refer to the ref for AP424).Toxicity:  poor hemo.lytic (HC50=220 uM). Found in multiple species. Updated Jan2015; 5/2020; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Conlon JM, Mechkarska M, Prajeep M, Sonnevend A, Coquet L, Leprince J, Jouenne T, Vaudry H, King JD.2012, United Arab Emirates, Asia
Literature Information.Title: Host-defense peptides in skin secretions of the tetraploid frog Silurana epitropicalis with potent activity against methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA).
